paper_abstract: Let G be a finite Abelian group and F a field such that char (F) does not divide vertical bar G vertical bar. Denote FG by the group algebra of G over F. A (semisimple) Abelian code is an ideal of FG. Two codes I-1 and I-2 of FG are G-equivalent if there exists an automorphism psi of G whose linear extension to FG maps I-1 onto I-2. In this paper, we give a necessary and sufficient condition for minimal Abelian codes to be G-equivalent and show how to correct some results in the literature.
paper_title: G-Equivalence in Group Algebras and Minimal Abelian Codes
